fields.description:
*Assessment*

When enabling LDAP/AD integration on 4.0 cloud, in the cloud-debug.log, it can be observed that the 'blockstorage' account tries to be synced.  If this is considered to be a 'special' account like 'eucalyptus', then should it show up in the logs as trying to be synced?

*Signs*

* output in cloud-debug.log:
{code}
....
Sun Mar 16 19:36:16 2014 DEBUG [DatabaseAuthProvider:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.Debugging.logError(Debugging.java):112] Failed to delete account blockstorage with exception org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement | com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities$CascadingTx$TxState.commit(Entities.java:1144) | com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities$CascadingTx.commit(Entities.java:1030) | com.eucalyptus.entities.TransactionResource.commit(TransactionResource.java:56) | com.eucalyptus.auth.DatabaseAuthProvider.deleteAccount(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:464) | com.eucalyptus.auth.Accounts.deleteAccount(Accounts.java:151) | com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.removeObsoleteAccounts(LdapSync.java:576) | com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.rebuildLocalAuthDatabase(LdapSync.java:348) | com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.sync(LdapSync.java:311) | com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1.run(LdapSync.java:268) |
Sun Mar 16 19:36:16 2014 ERROR [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.removeObsoleteAccounts(LdapSync.java):578] com.eucalyptus.auth.AuthException: No such account
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.removeObsoleteAccounts(LdapSync.java:576)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.rebuildLocalAuthDatabase(LdapSync.java:348)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.sync(LdapSync.java:311)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1.run(LdapSync.java:268)
Sun Mar 16 19:36:16 2014  WARN [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.removeObsoleteAccounts(LdapSync.java):579] Failed to delete account blockstorage
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.removeObsoleteAccounts(LdapSync.java:576)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.rebuildLocalAuthDatabase(LdapSync.java:348)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.sync(LdapSync.java:311)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1.run(LdapSync.java:268)
Sun Mar 16 19:36:16 2014 DEBUG [LdapSync:LDAP sync] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync$1.run(LdapSync.java):270] Sync ended
Sun Mar 16 19:37:45 2014 DEBUG [LdapSync:SystemClockTimer] [com.eucalyptus.auth.ldap.LdapSync.startSync(LdapSync.java):258] A new sync initiated.
...
{code}

*Steps*

* Set up Eucalyptus 4.0.0 cloud
* Use the following LIC file below, and enabled LDAP/AD sync:
{code}
# cat atliens-v3.lic
{

  "_comment":"This is a template of LDAP integration config file in JSON. For security, please create this template by using create_lic.pl command, which fill the <auth-credentials> in <ldap-service> section with encrypted password. After you make the changes, you can remove <_comment> lines in all sections (but you do not have to). Among all the sections, only <sync> section is mandatory. However, if sync is enabled, <ldap-service>, !!ONLY!! ONE of <accounting-groups> and <groups-partition>, <groups> and <users> become mandatory. The simplest configuration is disabled sync, with only <sync> section, in which <enable> is false.",

  "ldap-service":{

    "_comment":"This section defines configurations for LDAP service. <server-url> defines LDAP service URL. <auth-method> specifies the LDAP authentication method for the administrative identity designated to perform LDAP sync. <user-auth-method> specifies the LDAP authentication method for normal LDAP users. <auth-principal> defines the LDAP authentication user (for whom to access LDAP). <auth-credentials> field can have both un-encrypted and encrypted password. Encrypted password has a format as {RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding}xxxxxxxxxxxxx. <use-ssl> specifies whether to use SSL for LDAP connection for extra safety. <ignore-ssl-cert-validation> specifies whether to ignore SSL certificate validation, esp. for accepting self-signed certificates. <krb5-conf> specifies the krb5.conf file for GSSAPI with Kerbeors V5 authentication.",

    "server-url":"ldap://10.111.5.39:389",
    "auth-method":"simple",
    "user-auth-method":"simple",
    "auth-principal":"cn=Directory Manager,dc=atliens,dc=com",
    "auth-credentials":"{RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding}",
    "use-ssl":"false",
    "ignore-ssl-cert-validation":"false",
    "krb5-conf":"/etc/krb5.conf",
  },

  "sync":{

    "enable":"true",
    "auto":"true",
    "interval":"90000",
    "clean-deletion":"true",
  },

  "groups-partition":{

    "account1":["user01", "user02", "user03", "user04", "user05", "user06", "user07", "user08", "user09", "user10"],
    "account2":["user11", "user12", "user13", "user14", "user15", "user16", "user17", "user18", "user19", "user20"],
  },

  "groups":{

    "base-dn":"ou=groups,dc=twodopeboyz,dc=atliens,dc=com",
    "id-attribute":"cn",
    "member-attribute":"member",
    "selection":{

        "filter":"(&(objectClass=groupOfNames)(cn=*))",
    }
  },

  "users":{

    "base-dn":"ou=people,dc=twodopeboyz,dc=atliens,dc=com",
    "id-attribute":"uid",
    "sasl-id-attribute":"uid",
    "user-info-attributes":{
        "displayName":"Full Name",
        "title":"Title",
        "mail":"Email"
    },
    "selection":{

        "filter":"(&(objectClass=inetOrgPerson)(objectClass=posixAccount)(mail=*))",
    }
  },
}

$ euca-lictool --password password --custom atliens-v3.lic --out atliens-v3-4.0.lic --nocomment
$ euca-modify-property -f authentication.ldap_integration_configuration=atliens-v3-4.0.lic
{code}
* Observe 'blockstorage' account trying to be synced.
fields.summary: LDAP/AD integration tries to sync 'blockstorage' account and shows an error

comments.body: Ldap sync may delete the blockstorage account when EUCA-8818 is addressed.
Fixed due to component system account changes in EUCA-9043
Tried the steps in the reporting and found no error logs related to blockstorage account.
